paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the TTR gene, including functional data and penetrance information.

functional_data.summary: Aβ binding was significantly inhibited only in L82A, indicating that Aβ binding to TTR is mediated through this bulky hydrophobic leucine.

variants.additional_notes: The L82A variant shows altered binding properties but lacks patient data.
key_quotes: Aβ binding was significantly inhibited only in L82A and L110A.
Enhancement of binding in L17A is postulated to arise from reduced steric restriction.

functional_data.summary: Aβ binding was significantly inhibited only in L110A, indicating that Aβ binding to TTR is mediated through this bulky hydrophobic leucine.

variants.additional_notes: The L110A variant shows altered binding properties but lacks patient data.
key_quotes: Aβ binding was significantly inhibited only in L82A and L110A.

functional_data.summary: Aβ binding to L17A was significantly higher than to wild-type TTR.

variants.additional_notes: The L17A variant shows increased binding properties but lacks patient data.
key_quotes: Aβ binding to L17A was significantly higher than to wild-type TTR.

functional_data.summary: The S85A mutation caused a reduction in TTR tetramer stability; increased Aβ binding is postulated to be a direct consequence of the reduced quaternary stability.

variants.additional_notes: The S85A variant shows altered stability but lacks patient data.
key_quotes: The S85A mutation caused a reduction in TTR tetramer stability.

extraction_metadata.notes: All variants extracted were functional mutations with no patient data available.
